data.enText: to be very afraid of sth; to fear that sth bad is going to happen

data.chText: 这是他一直最担心的时刻。
data.enText: This was the moment he had been dreading.
She dreads her husband finding out.

data.chText: 我不敢想象假如这儿真的发生火灾会是什么情景。
data.enText: I dread to think what would happen if there really was a fire here.
a feeling of great fear about sth that might or will happen in the future; a thing that causes this feeling

data.chText: 想到人会一天天老下去便使我充满恐惧。
data.enText: The prospect of growing old fills me with dread .

data.chText: 她莫名其妙地害怕医院。
data.enText: She has an irrational dread of hospitals.

data.chText: 委员会成员整天提心吊胆，生怕有什么事会引起流言飞语。
data.enText: The committee members live in dread of (= are always worried about) anything that may cause a scandal.

data.chText: 我最担心的就是父母会察觉出来。
data.enText: My greatest dread is that my parents will find out.

ex.chText: 我怎样才能克服对狗的恐惧呢？
ex.enText: How can I overcome the fear of dogs?

ex.chText: 村民们生活在恐惧之中，害怕随时会被征召入伍。
ex.enText: The villagers lived in fear of being conscripted at any time.

synonyms.bx: 指对危险、令人害怕的事物、可能发生的坏事等产生的畏惧。

tips.tip: 表示“感到害怕”时，不要说 have fear, 而要说 be afraid 或 be frightened。

ex.chText: 他生活在恐惧中，害怕经理发现真相。
ex.enText: He lived in dread of the manager discovering the truth.

ex.chText: 鲁丝莫名其妙地害怕医院。
ex.enText: Ruth has an irrational dread of hospitals.

synonyms.bx: 指对将要发生的事或将来可能会发生的事的强烈畏惧。

example: the student looked around the examination room with apprehension
I fear the winters in Moscow
We should not fear the Communists!

value.def: If you dread something which may happen, you feel very anxious and unhappy about it because you think it will be unpleasant or upsetting.

example.tran: 今年我非常害怕过圣诞节。

example.ex: I dreaded coming back, to be honest...
I suffer badly from cold sores and dread them appearing on my wedding day...
example.tran: 我的唇疱疹很严重，我真担心它会在我的婚礼上发作。

example.ex: I'd been dreading that the birth would take a long time.
example.tran: 我一直十分担心分娩会花很长时间。

value.def: Dread is a feeling of great anxiety and fear about something that may happen.

example.ex: She thought with dread of the cold winters to come.
example.tran: 她害怕即将来临的寒冷冬季。

example.ex: ...a more effective national policy to combat this dread disease.
example.tran: 对抗这可怕疾病的更有效的国家政策

value.def: You can use dread to describe something that you, or a particular group of people, find annoying or undesirable.

example.tran: 令人不快的短语“政治上正确”

value.tran: 恼火的;生气的;不想要的

value.def: If you say that you dread to think what might happen, you mean that you are anxious about it because it is likely to be very unpleasant.

example.ex: I dread to think what will happen in the case of a major emergency...
example.tran: 我不敢想在重大紧急情况下会发生什么。

example.ex: I dread to think what Hollywood is planning to do with this interesting little story.
example.tran: 我不敢想好莱坞打算如何处理这个有趣的小故事。
